alert.note: Alert for Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washington and west central Bennington Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shaftsbury, or near Arlington, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads and in urban/poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Salem, Manchester, Shaftsbury, White Creek, North Bennington, Sunderland, Sandgate, Glastenbury, White Creek Station, Sodom, Chiselville, Post Corners, South Shaftsbury, Rexleigh, East Arlington, Eagleville, Anaquassacook, Hidden Valley and East Kansas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
